intro: Erysimum ochroleucum var. intermedium, commonly known as the intermediate whitlow grass, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the northeastern United States. It features slender, branching stems that produce clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant has basal leaves that are linear to oblanceolate in shape, often with a hairy texture. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wet meadows and along stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable species for ecological studies and wetland restoration projects.
